column2: Q4 2024 Earnings Call
column3: Feb 11
column4: 2025|3370673|Analysts|Russell Quelch|546081|581083949.0|3|Question|118252428|63|0|"Martina
column5: you talked about private credit being a major TAM opportunity in Ratings previously. Can you provide an update on where you are in terms of executing on this opportunity? Wondering if you can be specific perhaps around how much revenue private credit is contributing to Ratings right now.

column1: Any thoughts around sort of cadence of growth
column2: new products you're working on here
column3: conversations with the private credit houses would be useful. And perhaps
column4: just on a separate note
column5: do you have any view on the TAM opportunity for the Ratings business that might come if Fannie and Freddie are privatized?"|"Martina
column6: you talked about private credit being a major TAM opportunity in Ratings previously. Can you provide an update on where you are in terms of executing on this opportunity? Wondering if you can be specific perhaps around how much revenue private credit is contributing to Ratings right now.

column1: Any thoughts around sort of cadence of growth
column2: new products you're working on here
column3: conversations with the private credit houses would be useful. And perhaps
column4: just on a separate note
column5: do you have any view on the TAM opportunity for the Ratings business that might come if Fannie and Freddie are privatized?"

column2: Q4 2024 Earnings Call
column3: Feb 11
column4: 2025|3370673|Executives|Martina Cheung|429194|640442511.0|4|Answer|118252429|64|0|"Russell
column5: thanks so much for the question. So private credit
column6: indeed
column7: in Ratings has been a strong opportunity. One of the things that we have also said in addition to recognizing that opportunity is that we would rate deals wherever they come
column8: whether it's in the public market or the private markets.

column1: We also
column2: of course
column3: recognized back in 2022 the absolute importance of making sure that we were engaged at the right levels with the private market issuers
column4: and we've been very focused on that. You see that reflected in the results.

column1: The strong growth in the overall credit revenues for S&P Global were very much reflecting the strong growth in Ratings.
I would say that we have an incredible overall breadth of solutions around the private markets
column2: in addition to private credit
column3: and that's something that we're excited about as we go forward. It's the software businesses
column4: the marquee businesses
column5: Wall Street Office eye level
column6: but it's also the valuation solutions that we offer
column7: which are very much in demand.

column1: It's the private indices and the opportunity to innovate further there as well as the work that we're doing in credit ratings. And so I would say we would see a continuation of the hard work that the teams are doing across the divisions. We don't break out the revenue numbers by division
column2: but this continues to be a top area of focus for us.

column1: And I think on your last question with respect to Fannie and Freddie
column2: we're not going to speculate right now what that could look like. But certainly
column3: if there are more facts coming to the table on that
column4: we'll certainly get back to you on it.

column1: All right. So I'm going to go to some closing remarks. I want to say thanks so much for everybody joining us. I'm incredibly proud of our colleagues' performance in 2024. We've had incredible execution and great results.
Our people are focused on the right priorities
column2: customer engagement and rapid innovation. I do want to pause a second and give just a really
column3: really special thank you to Chris Craig for his work as Interim CFO. I have enjoyed working with Chris for every minute of that Interim CFO time period and look forward to continuing to work with you.

column1: And then looking ahead
column2: our focus remains clear. We have a really collaborative leadership team that is focused on delivering customer value. We're building on our legacy of disciplined execution. We have solid 2025 guidance
column3: and we're going to continue to create long-term profitable growth and shareholder value.

column1: And so let me just say this is the beginning. With our unparalleled data and technology
column2: our benchmarks and our people
column3: we're going to continue to unlock our potential
column4: and I look forward to sharing more. Thank you."|Russell
column5: thanks so much for the question.
